description: I’m deeply engaged in AI alignment and existential risks, concerned that advanced models might drift from their intended goals, so I monitor safety research breakthroughs—methods, benchmarks, and protocols—empirical experiments that reveal misalignment, policy and regulatory updates, and documented failures or accidents across sources like the AI 2027 blog and Guardian reporting to spot early warning signals. I’m also interested in quantum computing’s practical and scientific applications and their broader societal, economic, and ethical impacts.
userInterests: They want to stay informed about the latest AI capability reports—especially breakthroughs in large language models, robotics, multi-modal systems, and related areas. Their primary motivation is concern that these advances could inadvertently lead to a misaligned or unsafe AI. By focusing on research milestones and new capabilities, they hope to detect early warning signs of risky developments. This targeted news feed should help them monitor alignment threats more effectively.

curatedArticles.title: ‘I think you’re testing me’: Anthropic’s new AI model asks testers to come clean
curatedArticles.trailText: Safety evaluation of Claude Sonnet 4.5 raises questions about whether predecessors ‘played along’, firm says

curatedArticles.title: AI models may be developing their own ‘survival drive’, researchers say
curatedArticles.trailText: Like 2001: A Space Odyssey’s HAL 9000, some AIs seem to resist being turned off and will even sabotage shutdown

curatedArticles.title: OpenAI relaxed ChatGPT guardrails just before teen killed himself, family alleges
curatedArticles.trailText: Adam Raine’s suicide at 16 years old was ‘predictable result of deliberate design choices’ by OpenAI, his family says

curatedArticles.title: OpenAI promises more ‘granular control’ to copyright owners after Sora 2 generates videos of popular characters
curatedArticles.trailText: Company behind the AI video app says it will work with rights holders to ‘block characters from Sora at their request’

curatedArticles.title: ChatGPT ‘upgrade’ giving more harmful answers than previously, tests find
curatedArticles.trailText: Campaigners ‘deeply concerned’ about response to prompts about suicide, self-harm and eating disorders

curatedArticles.title: Harry and Meghan join AI pioneers in call for ban on superintelligent systems
curatedArticles.trailText: Nobel laureates also sign letter saying ASI technology should be barred until there is consensus that it can be developed ‘safely’

curatedArticles.title: British AI startup beats humans in international forecasting competition
curatedArticles.trailText: ManticAI ranked eighth in the Metaculus Cup, leaving some believing bots’ prediction skills could soon overtake experts

curatedArticles.title: Governments are spending billions on their own ‘sovereign’ AI technologies – is it a big waste of money?
curatedArticles.trailText: Many US-built AI systems fall short but competing against tech giants neither easy nor cheap

description: The user is personally curious about the fields of protein folding and nuclear fusion, driven by their potential to revolutionize healthcare through disease treatment and to provide sustainable energy solutions. This interest is fueled by the transformative impact these advancements could have on the future of humanity.
